intro: Errazurizia multifoliolata, commonly known as the many-leaved errazurizia, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are often deeply divided into numerous small leaflets. It produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. Errazurizia multifoliolata is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
